Key Match Events: The Pacers had a 17-2 second quarter run that turned a 30-29 deficit into a 46-31 lead.
Golden State never led again but cut the halftime deficit to five and closed within three early in the third quarter.
The Pacers responded well when Golden State got close, maintaining control of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Warriors: It’s hard to take much out of a game with so many key players on the bench. But Golden State played hard and Spencer and former Indiana high school and college star Trayce Jackson-Davis shined.

Pacers: The momentum continues to build for Indiana, which looks like it’s finally found its rhythm. Indiana has won all five games by 10 or more points, Haliburton has rediscovered his All-Star level, and with the Pacers getting healthy, their depth is helping, too.
Others: The game was part of the Pacers' five-game winning streak, matching their longest streak of the season.
The Pacers struggled to score in the paint in the first half but finished with a 54-46 scoring advantage inside.
